title: TidyJS Configuration
description: Configuration file for TidyJS import organization

extends.description: Path to another configuration file to extend from

match.description: Regex pattern to match imports for this group

order.description: Order of this group (lower numbers appear first)

default.description: Whether this is the default group for unmatched imports

isDefault.description: DEPRECATED: Use 'default' instead. Whether this is the default group for unmatched imports

priority.description: Priority when multiple groups match (higher priority wins)

importOrder.description: Order of import types within each group

default.description: Order for default imports (e.g., import React from 'react')

named.description: Order for named imports (e.g., import { useState } from 'react')

typeOnly.description: Order for type-only imports (e.g., import type { FC } from 'react')

removeUnusedImports.description: Remove imports that are not used in the code

removeMissingModules.description: Remove imports from modules that cannot be resolved

singleQuote.description: Use single quotes for import paths

sortEnumMembers.description: Sort enum members by name length (shortest first)

sortExports.description: Sort export specifiers by name length (shortest first)

sortClassProperties.description: Sort class properties by name length (shortest first)

sortTypeMembers.description: Sort interface and type literal properties by name length (shortest first)

organizeReExports.description: Organize and format re-export statements (export { ... } from '...')

enforceNewlineAfterImports.description: Ensure exactly one blank line between the last import and the following code

blankLinesBetweenGroups.description: Number of blank lines between import groups

trailingComma.description: Trailing comma on the last specifier in multiline imports

sortSpecifiers.description: Sort import specifiers: 'length' by string length, 'alpha' alphabetically, false to preserve order

maxLineWidth.description: Maximum line width for imports (0 = disabled)

mode.description: Resolution mode, or false to disable

aliases.description: Path aliases in tsconfig paths format. Keys are patterns (e.g. '@app/*'), values are arrays of relative paths (e.g. ['./src/app/*'])
